description: {WS{whards of unusual black ice are scattered around the ground.  The
flat expands out in all four directions.  {x
51765.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WU{wp ahead is a good-sized wide-open flat on the south side of the
peak that had been turned into a permanent camp.  Geographically it
couldn't have been planned any better, with elevated views of both air
and land for miles.  Any assault on the peak would be visible well in
advance, and easily prepared for defending.  {x
51761.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WA{w wrong step has sent you plummeting down the side of the mountain,
landing hard on shards of ice and packed snow.  Buried deep in the
snow, there are no available exits.  {x
51701.name: {WB{wuried {WI{wn {WA {WS{wnowpack!{x

description: {WT{whe view towards the valley floor below is unobstructed but
desolate.  Icewind Dale is some of the most barren landscape in
Faerun, and the lifeless unpopulated surface stretches for miles on
end.  {x
51714.name: {WF{wace {WO{wf {WT{whe {WM{wountain{x

description: {WI{wt appears as if small handholds and indentations have been carved
into the mountainside, and a makeshift route seems to have been made
straight up the rockface to the top.  {x
51719.name: {WC{wlimb {WT{wo {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {cK{*e{wl{Wv{wi{*n{c's {cC{wa{Wi{wr{cn{x is a testament to unknown forces that mold the
landscape throughout the lands.  Those who get the rare opportunity to
set foot atop the peak are greeted with conditions unique to the
mountain, found nowhere else.  A dropoff can be seen to the west.  {x
51763.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WH{wuge blocks of ice lay around the top of the mountain.  Everything
appears to be whitewashed and blended together, making it difficult to
discern specific features.  The ice here seems to shift and move ever
so slightly.  {x
51726.name: {WW{western {WE{wdge {WO{wf {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {WT{whis is an elbow that connects the circular train around the cairn
rim to the summit itself.  Continuing forward to the north will take
you directly to one of the peaks.  {x
51737.name: {WN{worthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WT{whe open peak continues in all directions.  Well packed ice and
snow give sure footing, but also caution.  The harsh wind flows
unopposed and beats down on the mountain with reckless abandon.  {x
51766.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WT{whis is the southwestern corner of the summit, with an open flat to
the north and east.  To the west and south are open dropoffs.  {x
51769.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WT{whe trail continues to work it's way around the western edge of the
summit, continuing to the south, or back to the entrance towards the
east.  To the north and west are more long dropoffs to the base of the
mountain.  {x
51727.name: {WW{western {WE{wdge {WO{wf {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {WT{whe southeastern edge of the summit can be seen just to the east.
A wall of sheer ice, impossible to climb, is to the north, while the
open flat continues to the west and south.  {x
51767.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WT{whe trail does not appear to be as heavily used here, but some time
has still been taken to carve and continue the path further up the
cairn.  {x
51718.name: {WC{wlimb {WT{wo {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {WT{wo south is a large rockface, with a single opening that joins the
northern and southern halves of the cairn.  The rockface serves as a
natural defense, with the opening as the only point of access.  {x
51749.name: {WN{worthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WW{wooden posts lined along the side of the shrine are topped by the
heads of what appears to be adventurers?  Surely these must be the
heads of the heroes who have climbed to mountain seeking answers the
mystery of the cairn, to never return.  Two humans, a half-elf, and
two dwarves stare ahead with empty expressions, frozen for eternity.  {x
51758.name: {WS{whrine {WO{wf {bT{Bh{Wr{By{bm{x

description: {WW{walking between two high rockfaces, a section of the summit is
revealed that has been constructed as a place of worship to the frost
giant deity Thrym.  Wooden stakes line the walls and a huge black
altar can be seen on the far side near the edge of the summit.  {x
51755.name: {WS{whrine {WO{wf {bT{Bh{Wr{By{bm{x

description: {WT{whe first leg shows the complexity and challenge of the climb up.
Unstable foot and hand holds, a slick layer of ice, loose snowpack,
and falling debris are the natural defense mechanisms of the cairn.
There's a short path to the east.  {x
51703.name: {WB{wase {WC{wlimb {WU{wp {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WT{whe trail continues, the temperature falling lower and lower with
each step.  The few signs of life here and there fade as the
conditions become more intolerable.  Another ledge can be seen above
you, and a short path heads west.  {x
51704.name: {WB{wase {WC{wlimb {WU{wp {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WA{wn intersection has paths that lead in all four directions.  To the
north is a downward grade to the northern half of the cairn, and to
the south is the open half of the southern end of the peak.  A short
path to the west leads to a sheer wall of oddly pitch black granite,
and large wooden stakes and what appears to be an altar can be seen
towards the east.  {x
51751.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WT{wo the south the trail angles downwards into a an open area with
high granite walls topped by a thick layer of snow.  The high walls
shade the area from any direct sunlight, and casts a dark shadow into
the recessed area.  {x
51732.name: {WE{wastern {WE{wdge {WO{wf {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {WJ{wudging the by the distance below, the summit can't be too far
away.  Clearing the next ledge would give an unobstructed view of the
mountaintop.  A sidestep west heads down, away from the summit.  {x
51721.name: {WC{wlimb {WT{wo {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {WH{wundreds of icicles can be seen hanging underneath a ledge above.
Any vibration may loosen these from their attachment to the ledge,
sending them plummeting below.  {x
51712.name: {WF{wace {WO{wf {WT{whe {WM{wountain{x

description: {WT{whe end of long climb has taken you to the summit of {cK{*e{wl{Wv{wi{*n{c's
{cC{wa{Wi{wr{cn{w, the source of the endless rumors and tall tales.  A slope to
the south leads to the summit itself.  {x
51723.name: {WC{wlimb {WT{wo {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {WT{whe terrain on the east side of the summit is more rugged and
disheveled, likely because the winds from the east pound this side of
mountain mercilessly for much of the year.  The snow is deep and
trudging is slow and treacherous, one slip could send someone down the
east face.  {x
51735.name: {WE{wastern {WO{wutcropping{x

description: {WC{whunks of crystal clear ice lay out in the open, light glistening
off of their surface.  To the south is a path out, and to the north
and east is more of the summit.  {x
51743.name: {WN{worthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WC{wontinuing to navigate the mountainside, the ledge angles to the
south, and another ledge can be seen below.  {x
51705.name: {WB{wase {WC{wlimb {WU{wp {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WA{ws the bend continues to stretch around the mountain, the rock
outcropping is quite large and suitable for a campsite.  Huge icicles
hang ominously overhead, releasing droplets of water which form small
puddles below.  {x
51711.name: {WB{wase {WC{wlimb {WU{wp {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WA {wtrail here traces its way around the eastern edge of the summit,
continuing to the south.  Large ice structures spiral upwards into the
sky, small towers of frozen water, slowly growing.  Long perilous
dropoffs are to the north and east.  {x
51729.name: {WE{wastern {WE{wdge {WO{wf {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {WT{whe sheer cliff face to the right, coupled with a narrowing of the
trail, makes this section the most treacherous so far.  Balance and
sure footing are a must.  The path continues upwards with a short
climb.  {x
51708.name: {WB{wase {WC{wlimb {WU{wp {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WS{wtanding at the northern tip on the peak of {cK{*e{wl{Wv{wi{*n{c's {cC{wa{Wi{wr{cn{w, a
wondrous, if not desolate, view of Icewind Dale can be seen for miles.
The only safe exit south, with potentially lethal dropoffs in all
other directions.  {x
51746.name: {WN{worthern {WO{wverlook{x

description: {WT{whe trail follows along the edge of a large glacial structure that
sits atop the summit.  The trail continues to the north and east.  {x
51730.name: {WE{wastern {WE{wdge {WO{wf {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {WO{wddly enough, two well defined paths can be seen here, one heading
towards the east and the other towards the west.  The snowpack has
also been compacted and tread upon, not what one would expect on a
barren mountain.  Perhaps those rumors aren't rumors after all...  {x
51724.name: {WE{wdge {WO{wf {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {WT{whe snow covered mountainface is a sheer wall of white powder,
threatening to come crashing down and burying the rock outcropping
under tons of snow.  {x
51717.name: {WF{wace {WO{wf {WT{whe {WM{wountain{x

description: {WA{w small clearing seems to mark the end of the path up to the top,
but just beyond the packed snowdrift you can barely make out what
looks like a path that could be, with extreme caution, navigated.  {x
51716.name: {WF{wace {WO{wf {WT{whe {WM{wountain{x

description: {WT{whis is the southeastern corner of the summit, with an open flat to
the north and west.  To the east and south are open dropoffs.  {x
51772.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WO{wne half of a huge black ice alter rests here, erected for the
frost giant deity {bT{Bh{Wr{By{bm {CT{che {CC{cold {CO{cne{w, as he is known.  Thrym was the
leader of the frost giants before he was turned into a deity, and the
giants have a fanatical following to their god.  The legendary
Crusaders of Thrym are especially feared for both their devotion and
prowess in battle.  {x
51760.name: {WS{whrine {WO{wf {bT{Bh{Wr{By{bm{x

description: {WT{whis is just another small open area on the top of the cairn.
There are no discerning features, just more snow, more rock, and more
ice.  Also to the north and east are dangerous dropoffs down the side
of the cairn.  {x
51739.name: {WW{western {WO{wutcropping{x

description: {WT{whe passageway abruptly ends here where a large {*obsidian obelisk{x is
buried in the snow.  A faint blue-ish aura can be seen surrounding the
obelisk, and a low humming can be heard.  Strange colors swirl on the
surface, at times even turning translucent in some parts.  {x
51752.name: {WI{wnside {WT{whe {WP{weak {WOf{w {cK{*e{wl{Wv{wi{*n{c's {cC{wa{Wi{wr{cn{x

description: {WV{wertical climbing and icy rocks make navigation up the cliff face
tricky.  One small misstep could send you crashing down the mountain.
A sidestep to the east leading to another set of holds that continue
upwards.  {x
51720.name: {WC{wlimb {WT{wo {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {WA {whalf dozen posts here are capped with the trophied heads of more
adventurers, the final resting spot of those who met a cruel and
unforgiving fate.  A half-orc, three elves, two kenkus and a tiny
pixie share this graveyard together, eerily preserved by the freezing
temperatures here on top of the cairn.  {x
51759.name: {WS{whrine {WO{wf {bT{Bh{Wr{By{bm{x

description: {WT{whe summit edge offers yet another of many views of Icewind Dale.
This particular spot gives a clear line of sight to the west and
south, but also in those directions are dropoffs that would send
anything plummeting down the mountain.  More sturdy footing is to the
north and east.  {x
51764.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WR{wounding around a bend, the trail widens and offers some relief
with a flat outcropping of rock overlooking the valley below.  The
frozen tundra of Icewind Dale can be seen below.  {x
51710.name: {WB{wase {WC{wlimb {WU{wp {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WU{wnnatural debris laying about the peak confirm the rumors and
stories circulating throughout the realms.  The cairn is indeed
inhabited, and anything that can tolerate the conditions here would
surely be durable and proficient in combat.  {x
51762.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WT{whe arduous climb continues upwards, or heads down towards the base
of the mountain towards the north.  {x
51706.name: {WB{wase {WC{wlimb {WU{wp {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WA {wtrail here traces its way around the western edge of the summit,
continuing to the south.  Long dropoffs can be seen to the north and
west.  {x
51725.name: {WW{western {WE{wdge {WO{wf {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {WD{weep snow underfoot has a slight give, leaving footprint
impressions of all sizes heading every which way.  A lot of activity
seems to take place here, on a regular basis.  {x
51770.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WA{wpproaching what initially appears to be a slab of granite is, in
fact, a huge door made out of black ice.  It angles into the snow and
blends in with the surrounding terrain very efficiently.  There does
not appear to be any traditional mechanisms to open the door.  {x
51754.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WS{wlivers of ice are blown about in an otherwise nondescript surface.
There is nothing but pure white snow here.  A dropoff is to the north
and west.  {x
51744.name: {WN{worthern {WO{wverlook{x

description: {WT{whis small gully, shielded from the harsh winds, is filled with one
large pile of snow about 15 feet high.  To the south is a rock face
angled backwards, making it impossible to climb over.  {x
51736.name: {WE{wastern {WO{wutcropping{x

description: {WT{whe cold sub-zero temperatures here make the Sands of Sorrow a
welcome thought.  The constant freezing climate make the cairn an
unsuitable living locale for any humanoid race, and most beasts for
that matter.  Any living creature calling the cairn it's home must
have incredible fortitude and stamina.  {x
51741.name: {WW{western {WO{wutcropping{x

description: {WT{whe lack of direct sunlight on the backside of the mountain has
allowed ice and snow to accumulate to hazardous levels.  Chunks of ice
have broken off the overhang and have come crashing down into large
piles.  {x
51733.name: {WE{wastern {WO{wutcropping{x

description: {WT{whe snowpack here is beginning to show some signs of heavy use.  2
feet deep in most parts, there also appears to be large indentations
in the snow, almost like footprints.  {x
51738.name: {WW{western {WO{wutcropping{x

description: {WL{wike a crooked finger, a narrow strip of the snow-covered cairn
extends out to the north.  Steep drops are to the north and east.  {x
51747.name: {WN{worthern {WO{wverlook{x

description: {WC{wlimbing onto this ledge, this is the last leg on the long climb to
the to the top of {cK{*e{wl{Wv{wi{*n{c's {cC{wa{Wi{wr{cn{w.  The summit is to the south.  {x
51722.name: {WC{wlimb {WT{wo {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {WT{whe path through the crevice angles up sharply and leads to higher
level on the peak.  Any serious attempt to take the mountain would
likely end here, as any attackers would have a daunting task of
charging attackers in an elevated position, with only one point of
attack.  {x
51750.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WT{whe tread is heavy and a diverse number of footprints head off in
all directions.  Anything that can withstand the extreme conditions
here would be a formidable opponent in battle.  {x
51771.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WT{whe frozen tundra of Icewind Dale can be seen to the east, along
with a long dropoff down the side of the mountain, while open areas
are to the west and south.  {x
51768.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WJ{wagged outlines of shadows cast by the mountain make this section
difficult to navigate.  It continues to the north, or downwards to the
bottom.  {x
51707.name: {WB{wase {WC{wlimb {WU{wp {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WL{warge wooden posts here are capped off with frozen heads of a
variety of creatures, used in the rites and rituals for Thrym.  Of
note is the large head of a gold dragon, tongue removed, eyes replaced
by black gems - a mockery of such a noble and lawful creature.  {x
51756.name: {WS{whrine {WO{wf {bT{Bh{Wr{By{bm{x

description: {WT{whis narrow path winds it's way around the snow-covered mountain.
On one side is a steep embankment dropping down to a huge snow drift.
{x
51709.name: {WB{wase {WC{wlimb {WU{wp {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WA {wmound of debris is piled high here, sharp rocks protruding in all
directions.  The jagged edges blend in well with shadows cast from a
wall of rock to the south.  To west is yet another hazardous dropoff.
{x
51740.name: {WW{western {WO{wutcropping{x

description: {WD{wwarf-sized pine trees and small bits of vegetation grow along the
mountain here.  Rocks and boulders of all sizes are strewn about.  {x
51715.name: {WF{wace {WO{wf {WT{whe {WM{wountain{x

description: {WT{whe opening into the cairn quickly slopes downward, and shortly
ahead a large structure can be seen in the snow.  This passageway
appears large enough to accommodate something roughly the size of....
A giant.  {x
51753.name: {WI{wnside {WT{whe {WP{weak {WOf{w {cK{*e{wl{Wv{wi{*n{c's {cC{wa{Wi{wr{cn{x

description: {WB{wesides the sparse plant life, there are no visible signs of any
creatures inhabiting this barren mountainside.  A pile of boulders can
be seen to the east.  {x
51713.name: {WF{wace {WO{wf {WT{whe {WM{wountain{x

description: {WO{wne half of an absolutely enormous altar created from a single slab
of black ice rests here on top of the mountain.  It spans 20 feet long
and 8 feet wide, worthy of the frost giant deity Thrym.  It has been
chiseled with various crude reliefs depicting Thrym amidst battle, and
the top has been smoothed down to a pale luster.  The other half of
the altar continues to the south.  {x
51757.name: {WS{whrine {WO{wf {bT{Bh{Wr{By{bm{x

description: {WS{wtepping into a small clearing, the mountain appears disturbed from
it's natural state.  Rocks have been cleared out and snowpack moved to
the edges, as if making sure this area is kept clear for open
movement.  {x
51742.name: {WN{worthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WG{wusts of wind swirl around in little tornadoes, stirring up plumes
of snow in all directions.  A path leading around the edge of the
summit begins in the south, while the part of the peak is to the
north.  {x
51748.name: {WN{worthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WL{wooming above is an ominous sight, the snow-covered peak of {cK{*e{wl{Wv{wi{*n{c's
{cC{wa{Wi{wr{cn{w.  Gossip surrounding the mountain can be heard in taverns
throughout the Realms, but one would suspect it to be mostly rumors
and tall tales.  Odd noises, moving shadows, heroes going up to the
top but never returning...  All the standard fare.  {x
51700.name: {WB{wase {WO{wf {cK{*e{wl{Wv{wi{*n{c's {cC{wa{Wi{wr{cn{x

description: {WT{whe center of the northern half of the summit looks a little
disturbed.  Blocks of ice have been moved towards the edges, possibly
even over the side.  Dodgy ledges are to the north, east, and west,
while to the south a crevasse cuts through a rock wall.  {x
51745.name: {WN{worthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{

description: {WT{whe easternmost edge of the summit is dark and foreboding.  A rocky
near vertical fall to the bottom is to the north and east, while safer
ground is to the west and south.  {x
51734.name: {WE{wastern {WO{wutcropping{x

description: {WT{whe southernmost point of the summit is also it's highest, a 360
degree view on top of the world.  More of the summit is to the north
and east, while a steep wall of snow to the bottom is to the south and
west.  {x
51773.name: {WS{wouthern {WH{walf {WO{wf {WT{whe {WC{wairn{x

description: {WJ{wust up ahead the summit path appears to open up into a small
alcove.  A cold wind can be felt roaring it's way through the narrow
gorge formed by two sheer walls that form a natural funnel.  {x
51728.name: {WW{western {WE{wdge {WO{wf {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {WT{whe trail continues to work it's way around the eastern edge of the
summit, continuing to the south, or back to the entrance towards the
west.  The hazards of the open trail continue, as a wrong step to the
north or east would send anyone plummeting down the face of the
mountain.  {x
51731.name: {WE{wastern {WE{wdge {WO{wf {WT{whe {WS{wummit{x

description: {WA{w long twisting path upwards begins here, leading into the unknown.
A cold chilling breeze can be felt flowing down the face of the
mountain.  {x
51702.name: {WB{wase {WO{wf {cK{*e{wl{Wv{wi{*n{c's {cC{wa{Wi{wr{cn{x

description:
{xA rabbit with a white fur coat and bushy tail camouflages right in 
with the snow.  Beady black eyes and the occasional twitch of it's ears 
and whiskers gives away it's postion, but otherwise sits motionless.{x
51700.room_name: {xA {Wwhite rabbit{x hops about, minding it's own business.{x
51700.name: {xa {Wwhite rabbit{x~
subroutines:
F off FH
F for G

description:
{xWhite feathers with light brown streaks hide the owl with the landscape 
as it flies through the air.  It has two large owl eyes, and a tiny beak.{x
51701.room_name: {xA {Wsnow owl{x flies around, hunting insects and small mammals.{x
51701.name: {xa {Wsnow owl{x~
subroutines:
F off F
F for W

description:
{xA large shapeless pearl white, semi-transparent mass ambles along the 
ground.  It's dimensions seem to change and morph at will.  It doesn't have 
any organs or body parts, just a shimmering, faceless mass that exists only 
to feed itself.{x
51702.room_name: {xA white pudding bubbles and oozes as it creeps over the snow.{x
51702.name: {xa {WW{wh{Wi{wt{We {WP{wu{Wd{wd{Wi{wn{Wg{x~
subroutines:
F for MV
F par ABCDGHIJK

description:
{xA large owlbear lumbers about.  It is evident by it's massive body and 
arms that is has immense crushing power and could do quite a bit of damage 
with it's bare hands.{x
51703.room_name: {xA white owlbear trudges through the snow, patrolling the area.{x
51703.name: {xa {WW{white {wO{*wlbear{x~
subroutines:
F off D
F res I

description:
{xThis long limbed troll makes it's home in sub-zero temperatures, making 
the top of the cairn an ideal location.  The top of it's head is covered by 
long think strands of pure white hair, with pitch black eyes staring into 
nothingness.{x
51704.room_name: {xA lanky boil-ridden {Wtroll{x wanders aimlessly looking for it's next meal.{x
51704.name: {xa {WS{wnow {WT{wroll{x~
subroutines:
F aff Jc
F res E
F vul HK

description:
{xThis yeti is another of many creatures which seem to call the summit 
it's "home".  With no reliable food source, it's a good bet that this yeti 
was in fact, deliberately transported here to act as some sort of guardian.{x
51705.room_name: {xAn immense yeti keeps a vigilant watch on the top of the summit.{x
51705.name: {xa Greater Ice Yeti{x~

description:
{xAn ice elemental with a blue-ish hue stands vigilant.  It's almost see 
through structure is an impressive sight, a solid moving mass of pure ice.{x
51706.room_name: {x A conjured {WI{Cc{We {WE{wl{ce{Cm{We{Cn{ct{wa{Wl{x stands steadfast and alert.{x
51706.name: {xan {WI{Cc{We {WE{wl{ce{Cm{We{Cn{ct{wa{Wl{x~

description:
{xA frost giant, a tad small by normal standards, appears to meditate in the 
snow.  He is focused and unaware of his surroundings.  Any questions on
